original: sems can gang smon pa med pa la spyod pa de dag ni smon pa med pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: sems can gang smon pa med pa la spyod pa de dag ni smon pa med pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Those sentient beings who practice without wishes, he joins to the practice without wishes.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum la gnas te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum la gnas te /
translated: dwell in the three concentrations

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: and bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: le'u bzhin bcu gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u bzhin bcu gcig pa'o ////
translated: This was the eleventh chapter, “The Three Concentrations,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya bzhi bcu pa //
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya bzhi bcu pa //
translated: Volume 240

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra🔽said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la rmi lam du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par zhugs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la rmi lam du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par zhugs na /
translated: “Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings enter into the three meditative stabilizations—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—in a dream,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel lam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel lam /
translated: does the perfection of wisdom increase?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gal te nyin par bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel na /
analyzed: gal te nyin par bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel na /
translated: if it increases through meditation during the day,

original: rmi lam na bsgoms pas kyang rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: rmi lam na bsgoms pas kyang rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: it also increases through meditation in a dream.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @208b tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: @208b tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rmi lam dang nyin par ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang nyin par ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: dreams and the daytime are not conceptualized.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom during the day,

original: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yod na ni /
analyzed: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yod na ni /
translated: if they have meditation on the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i rmi lam na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa'ang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i rmi lam na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa'ang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti, is it possible that a bodhisattva great being might cultivate the perfection of wisdom in a dream?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du las shig byas na; las de la sogs pa 'am bri bar 'gyur pa yod dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du las shig byas na; las de la sogs pa 'am bri bar 'gyur pa yod dam /
translated: if a bodhisattva great being performs an action in a dream, does that action increase or decrease?”

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur gsungs na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur gsungs na /
translated: “If the Blessed One has said that all phenomena are like a dream,

original: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: then there is no increase or decrease there.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: rmi lam gyi chos gang yang sogs pa 'am 'bri ba mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi chos gang yang sogs pa 'am 'bri ba mi dmigs te /
translated: “Because no phenomenon of a dream is observed to increase or decrease.

original: gal te sad nas rnam par rtog na ni /
analyzed: gal te sad nas rnam par rtog na ni /
translated: If one conceptualizes it after waking up,

original: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar yang 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar yang 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: then there is increase and decrease there.”

original: nyin par srog bcad pa dang / rmi lam na srog bcad pa de la 'di snyam du de bdag gis bsad do //
analyzed: nyin par srog bcad pa dang / rmi lam na srog bcad pa de la 'di snyam du de bdag gis bsad do //
translated: “If someone kills a living being in the daytime and kills a living being in a dream, does that person think, ‘I have killed this one,🔽but not that one’?

original: de bdag gis bsad pa legs so zhes sad de rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: de bdag gis bsad pa legs so zhes sad de rnam par rtog na /
translated: “It is good that I have killed him.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: las de la khyod ci zer smras pa /
analyzed: las de la khyod ci zer smras pa /
translated: what do you say about that karma?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: dmigs pa med par las mi skye'o //🔽dmigs pa med @209a *//
analyzed: dmigs pa med par las mi skye'o // dmigs pa med @209a *//
translated: karma does not arise without an object.

original: par sems pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: par sems pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: An intention does not arise without an object.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: ” Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just so.

original: dmigs pa med par las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par las mi skye'o //
translated: Karma does not arise without an object.

original: dmigs pa med par sems pa mi 'byung ngo //🔽dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par sems pa mi 'byung ngo // dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
translated: An intention does not arise without an object.

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //🔽dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no // dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: Karma arises with an object, not without an object.

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: An intention arises with an object, not without an object.

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i chos rnams la blo 'jug ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i chos rnams la blo 'jug ste /
translated: The mind engages with phenomena that are seen, heard, considered, and cognized.🔽It does not engage with phenomena that are not seen, not heard,

original: ma mthong / ma thos /
analyzed: ma mthong / ma thos /
translated: not considered, and not cognized.

original: ma bsams / rnam par ma rig pa'i chos la ni blo mi 'jug go /
analyzed: ma bsams / rnam par ma rig pa'i chos la ni blo mi 'jug go /
translated: The mind does not engage with phenomena that are not imagined and not misknown.

original: de la blo la la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la blo la la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Some minds grasp at afflictive phenomena,

original: blo la la ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: blo la la ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: and some minds grasp at purified phenomena.

original: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Therefore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
translated: actions arise with reference points,

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: not without reference points.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thoughts arise with reference points,

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: not without reference points.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldanpa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldanpa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāradvatīputra then asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: las thams cad dang / sems pa thams cad dben pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na /
analyzed: las thams cad dang / sems pa thams cad dben pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na /
translated: since the Blessed One has said that all actions and all thoughts are isolated,

original: de ji ltar dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
translated: how is it that actions arise with reference points,

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin /
translated: not without reference points,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: and that thoughts arise with reference points,

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: not without reference points?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @209b radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @209b radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: mtshan mar byas na dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar byas na dmigs pa dang bcas par las skye ste /
translated: If one makes a sign, one will give rise to karma with reference points.

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: It is not without reference points.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: One will give rise to thoughts with reference points.

original: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: It is not without reference points.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du sbyin pa byin /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du sbyin pa byin /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings give gifts,

original: tshul khrims bsrungs /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs /
translated: maintain ethical discipline,

original: bzod pa bsgrubs /
analyzed: bzod pa bsgrubs /
translated: cultivate patience,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams /
translated: exert vigor,

original: bsam gtan la mnyam par bzhag /
analyzed: bsam gtan la mnyam par bzhag /
translated: meditate in meditative concentration,

original: shes rab bsgoms te /
analyzed: shes rab bsgoms te /
translated: and cultivate wisdom in a dream,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na; des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na; des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ram /
translated: and if they then dedicate that wholesome action to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, will it be a dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa skye ba gcig gis thogs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa skye ba gcig gis thogs pa /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, who is separated from buddhahood by a single birth,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa 'di mngon du gyur na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa 'di mngon du gyur na /
translated: who has been predicted by the Blessed One to the irreversible stage,

original: 'di la dris shig dang / 'di lan glon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la dris shig dang / 'di lan glon par 'gyur ro //
translated: and ask him, and he will answer your question.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni 'di skad du /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di mngon du gyur pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa phyir mi ldog par bcom ldan 'das @210a *//
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni 'di skad du / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di mngon du gyur pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa phyir mi ldog par bcom ldan 'das @210a *//
translated: this elder Subhūti says,

original: kyis lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kyis lung bstan pa ste /
translated: ‘The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, who is separated from buddhahood by a single birth, who has been predicted by the Blessed One to the irreversible stage,

original: 'di la dris shig dang / 'di lan glon par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di la dris shig dang / 'di lan glon par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and ask him, and he will answer your question.’

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:🔽

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'di lan glon nam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'di lan glon nam /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya having said that, said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is it the name ‘bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya’ that answers,

original: 'on te gzugs lan glon nam /🔽'on te tshor ba lan glon nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs lan glon nam / 'on te tshor ba lan glon nam /
translated: or is it form that answers,🔽or is it feeling that answers,

original: 'on te 'du shes lan glon nam /
analyzed: 'on te 'du shes lan glon nam /
translated: or is it perception that answers,

original: 'on te 'du byed lan glon nam /
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed lan glon nam /
translated: or is it volitional factors that answer,

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: or is it consciousness that answers?

original: 'on te gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /🔽'on te tshor ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram / 'on te tshor ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or is it the emptiness of form that answers,🔽or is it the emptiness of feeling that answers,

original: 'on te 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: or is it the emptiness of perception that answers,

original: 'on te 'du byed kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: or is it the emptiness of volitional factors that answers,🔽or is it the emptiness of consciousness that answers?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will the emptiness of consciousness respond?

original: 'on te gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /🔽tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will the suchness of form respond?🔽Or will the suchness of feeling respond?

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will the suchness of perception respond?

original: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will the suchness of volitional factors respond?

original: rnam par shes pa'i de @210b bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de @210b bzhin nyid gang yin pa de lan glon par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will the suchness of consciousness respond?

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //🔽tshor ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do // tshor ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The emptiness of form has no power to respond.🔽The emptiness of feeling has no power to respond.

original: 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The emptiness of perception has no power to respond.

original: 'du byed kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The emptiness of volitional factors has no power to respond.

original: rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The emptiness of consciousness has no power to respond.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //🔽tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do // tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The suchness of form has no power to respond.🔽The suchness of feeling has no power to respond.

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The suchness of perception has no power to respond.

original: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The suchness of volitional factors has no power to respond.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni lan glon pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The suchness of consciousness has no power to respond.

original: bdag gis ni gang lan glon pa dang / gang gis lan glon pa dang / gang gi lan glon pa dang / gang la lan glon pa'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis ni gang lan glon pa dang / gang gis lan glon pa dang / gang gi lan glon pa dang / gang la lan glon pa'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see any dharma that is the one who is to be repaid, or the one by whom it is to be repaid, or the one to whom it is to be repaid, or the one by whom it is to be repaid.

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / gang gis lung bstan pa dang / gang la lung bstan pa'i chos de'ang bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / gang gis lung bstan pa dang / gang la lung bstan pa'i chos de'ang bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see any dharma that is the one who is to be prophesied, or the one by whom it is to be prophesied, or the one to whom it is to be prophesied, or the one by whom it is to be prophesied.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o //
translated: All those dharmas are nondual and indivisible.

original: sh'a @211a *// radva ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a @211a *// radva ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: chos de dag ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du chos de dag khyod kyis mngon du byas sam /
analyzed: chos de dag ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du chos de dag khyod kyis mngon du byas sam /
translated: “Are those dharmas that you have explained realized by you as they are?”

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya said,

original: chos de dag ji skad bshad pa de ltar chos de dag bdag gis mngon sum du byas pa med do //
analyzed: chos de dag ji skad bshad pa de ltar chos de dag bdag gis mngon sum du byas pa med do //
translated: “Those dharmas that I have explained are not realized by me as they are.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra had this thought:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “This bodhisattva great being Maitreya is endowed with profound wisdom.

original: 'di ltar 'di'ang yun ring por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'ang yun ring por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang /
translated: Thus, he has practiced the perfection of generosity for a long time, practiced the perfection of discipline, practiced the perfection of patience, practiced the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas bstan pa ste /
translated: practiced the perfection of concentration, and practiced the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs par spyod pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs par spyod pas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught by one who practices without apprehending anything.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: chos gang gis khyod dgra bcom par brjod pa'i chos de khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
analyzed: chos gang gis khyod dgra bcom par brjod pa'i chos de khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
translated: “Have you seen that dharma by which you are called an arhat?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān,

original: de ni mi lags so //
analyzed: de ni mi lags so //
translated: I have not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is exactly so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @211b rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni 'di snyam du lung bstan pa'i chos de ni 'di'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @211b rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni 'di snyam du lung bstan pa'i chos de ni 'di'o //
translated: When great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, they do not think, ‘This is the dharma that is prophesied.

original: lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de ni 'di'o //
analyzed: lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de ni 'di'o //
translated: This is the dharma that will be prophesied.

original: lung bstan par gyur pa'i chos de ni 'di'o //
analyzed: lung bstan par gyur pa'i chos de ni 'di'o //
translated: This is the dharma that has been prophesied.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos de ni 'di'o zhes bya bar mi sems te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos de ni 'di'o zhes bya bar mi sems te /
translated: This is the dharma that will attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.’

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: Great bodhisattva beings who practice accordingly practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: de la the tshom skye ba med cing /
analyzed: de la the tshom skye ba med cing /
translated: and there is no doubt about that.

original: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bdag ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: I will without doubt fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gang de ltar spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i //
analyzed: gang de ltar spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i //
translated: those who practice in that way practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who practice in that way are fearless, unafraid, and unterrified,

original: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: and think, ‘I will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bdag ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: I will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: @212a *// ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing /
analyzed: @212a *// ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings complete the six perfections

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa lags /
translated: and approach the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di slad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di slad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having said that, the Lord said to him,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of giving,

original: sems can bkres pa rnams mthong zhing /
analyzed: sems can bkres pa rnams mthong zhing /
translated: they see beings who are hungry,

original: sems can skom pa dang / gos ngan pa dang / zas dang / gos dang / mal chas 'phongs pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: sems can skom pa dang / gos ngan pa dang / zas dang / gos dang / mal chas 'phongs pa dag mthong na /
translated: When they see sentient beings who are thirsty, who are poorly clothed, who are in need of food, clothing, and bedding,

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /🔽ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste / ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
translated: they should reflect as follows:🔽“In whatever buddhafield I attain unsurpassed perfect awakening, may all these faults of sentient beings never exist at all, may they be non-existent,

original: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi longs spyod dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi longs spyod dang /
translated: and may the enjoyments of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the Trāyastriṃśa realm, the Yāma realm, the Tuṣita realm, the Nirmāṇarati realm, and the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm be present for sentient beings in my buddhafield.”

original: skyid pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i longs spyod dang / skyid par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya @212b ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: skyid pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i longs spyod dang / skyid par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya @212b ste; rab 'byor /
translated: Just as it is with the happiness, so it is with the enjoyments and pleasures of that buddha-field.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses thus, fulfills the perfection of giving,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: and he approaches the supreme enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽sems can srog gcod pa dag mthong ngam /🔽sems can ma byin par len pa dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / sems can srog gcod pa dag mthong ngam / sems can ma byin par len pa dag mthong ngam /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of morality,🔽when he sees beings who are violent,🔽who are thieves,

original: sems can 'dod pas log par g-yem par dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can 'dod pas log par g-yem par dag mthong ngam /
translated: who are given to sexual misconduct,

original: sems can brdzun du smra ba dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can brdzun du smra ba dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings who lie?

original: sems can phra ma zer ba dag mthong ngam /🔽sems can zhe gcod pa'i tshig can dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can phra ma zer ba dag mthong ngam / sems can zhe gcod pa'i tshig can dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings who slander?🔽Have you seen sentient beings who speak harshly?

original: sems can tshig bkyal pa smra ba dag mthong ngam /🔽sems can chags sems can dag mthong ngam /🔽sems can gnod sems can dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can tshig bkyal pa smra ba dag mthong ngam / sems can chags sems can dag mthong ngam / sems can gnod sems can dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings who gossip?🔽Have you seen sentient beings with covetous minds?🔽Have you seen sentient beings with malicious minds?

original: sems can log par blta ba can dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can log par blta ba can dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings with wrong views?

original: sems can tshe thung ba dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can tshe thung ba dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings with short lives?

original: sems can nad mang ba dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can nad mang ba dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings with many sicknesses?

original: sems can mdog ngan pa dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can mdog ngan pa dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings with bad complexions?

original: sems can mthu chung ngu dag mthong ngam /🔽sems can longs spyod chung ngu dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can mthu chung ngu dag mthong ngam / sems can longs spyod chung ngu dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings with little strength?🔽Have you seen sentient beings with few resources?

original: sems can rigs dma' ba dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can rigs dma' ba dag mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings of low social standing?

original: sems can yan lag dang / nying lag ma tshang ba dag mthong na /
analyzed: sems can yan lag dang / nying lag ma tshang ba dag mthong na /
translated: Have you seen sentient beings with incomplete limbs and digits?

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: When you see these, you should investigate as follows:

original: ci nas kyang bdag @213a *//
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag @213a *//
translated: “In what way should I

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
translated: In the Buddha-field of that Buddha who has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: all of these faults of sentient beings will not occur at all, will not be possible, and all sentient beings will be established in the ten wholesome actions.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: complete the perfection of morality

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: and get close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of morality

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of patience,

original: sems can phan tshun gnod par sems pa rdo dang dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis 'debs shing /
analyzed: sems can phan tshun gnod par sems pa rdo dang dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis 'debs shing /
translated: if they see sentient beings harming each other with stones, sticks, and weapons,

original: rdeg pa dang / gsod pa dag mthong na de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rdeg pa dang / gsod pa dag mthong na de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: striking and killing each other, they should investigate as follows:

original: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
translated: “In whatever way I may fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and buddhahood,

original: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang sems can @213b thams cad la ma lta bu'i sems su 'gyur ba dang / pha lta bu'i sems su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang sems can @213b thams cad la ma lta bu'i sems su 'gyur ba dang / pha lta bu'i sems su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: in that buddhafield, all these faults of sentient beings will not exist anywhere, will not be possible, and all sentient beings will have a mind toward all sentient beings like that of a mother, like that of a father,

original: phu nu lta bu'i sems su 'gyur pa dang / sring mo lta bu'i sems su 'gyur ba dang / byams pa'i sems su 'gyur ba dang / phan pa'i sems su 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: phu nu lta bu'i sems su 'gyur pa dang / sring mo lta bu'i sems su 'gyur ba dang / byams pa'i sems su 'gyur ba dang / phan pa'i sems su 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: They should think, ‘I will practice the perfection of patience in such and such a way that I will have a mind like a father, like a mother, like a brother, like a sister, like a friend, like a son, like a daughter, a loving mind, and a helpful mind.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: complete the perfection of patience

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: and get close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of perseverance,

original: sems can brtson 'grus zhan pa dang / le lo'i sems dang ldan pa dang / theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can brtson 'grus zhan pa dang / le lo'i sems dang ldan pa dang / theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: they see that beings are weak in perseverance, have lazy minds, and are not practicing the three vehicles,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dag mthong na /
translated: If they see those who turn their backs on the Way of the Disciples, the Way of the Solitary Sages, and the Way of the Buddhas,

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: they should think as follows:

original: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni /🔽sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang brtson 'grus brtan pa brtsams shing theg @214a *//
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni / sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang brtson 'grus brtan pa brtsams shing theg @214a *//
translated: ‘In whatever way I can, I will practice to attain unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment.🔽In my Buddha-field, all of these faults of sentient beings will not exist at all, and will not be possible.

original: pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: And all sentient beings will practice with firm perseverance, and will attain complete nirvāṇa through the three ways.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices like this will perfect the perfection of effort.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: He will also approach unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhuti, when Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of meditation,

original: sems can 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dang / sgrib pa lngas bsgribs pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: sems can 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dang / sgrib pa lngas bsgribs pa mthong ngam /
translated: they see sentient beings obscured by the five obscurations: desire, malice, harmfulness, laziness, and doubt.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: They see those who do not possess the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: They see those who do not possess the second concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: They see those who do not possess the third concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: They see those who do not possess the fourth concentration.

original: byams pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: byams pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not loving?

original: snying rje dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: snying rje dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not compassionate?

original: dga' ba dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not joyful?

original: btang snyoms dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not equanimous?

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not absorbed in the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space?

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not absorbed in the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness?

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms @214b par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms @214b par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not absorbed in the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing at all?

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong na /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa mthong na /
translated: Do you see anyone who is not absorbed in the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: When you see this, you should investigate as follows:

original: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
translated: ‘In what way will I, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad bsam gtan thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshad med pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad bsam gtan thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshad med pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: attain the immeasurables, and attain the formless absorptions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o //
translated: I will purify a Buddha-field.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: I will bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that complete the perfection of concentration

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur ba yin no //
translated: and get close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom get close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab 'chal pa can gyi sems can 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa can gyi sems can 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag par lta ba dang bral ba /
translated: they see sentient beings with faulty wisdom, who are devoid of mundane and supramundane correct views,

original: bya ba ma yin par smra ba /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin par smra ba /
translated: who speak of what should not be done,

original: med par smra ba /
analyzed: med par smra ba /
translated: who speak of nonexistence,

original: chad par smra ba /
analyzed: chad par smra ba /
translated: who speak of annihilation,

original: rtag @215a *// par smra ba /
analyzed: rtag @215a *// par smra ba /
translated: who speak of permanence,

original: sems can du smra ba dag mthong na /
analyzed: sems can du smra ba dag mthong na /
translated: and who speak of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: They should investigate as follows:

original: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /
translated: “In what way will I, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, in that buddhafield🔽ensure that all these faults of sentient beings never occur, that they are impossible, and that all sentient beings will abandon all aspects of views,

original: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad spangs shing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang / sems can thams cad lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad spangs shing /
translated: and

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: “I must practice the perfection of wisdom in such and such a way that I will stand in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o //
translated: “I must purify a buddhafield.”

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: “I must bring beings to maturity.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that complete the perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no // rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: and get close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: sems can phung po gsum la gnas pa nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: sems can phung po gsum la gnas pa nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa dag mthong na /

analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: ’ “One should investigate as follows:

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the six perfections,

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can dag mthong ngam /
translated: if they see beings in the hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can dag mthong na /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can dag mthong na /
translated: or see beings in the animal world or the world of Yama,

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: they should investigate as follows:🔽‘In whatever way I may fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na /

analyzed: chung ngu na ngan song gsum gyi sgra'ang mi sgrag  cing /

analyzed: mi srid pa de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //

translated: I should purify a buddha-field.🔽I should develop beings.’

analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang @216a *//
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like that

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed /

translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the six perfections,

original: sa chen po 'di la sdong du ma dang / tsher ma dang / sab sub dang / gcong rong dang / g-yang sa dang / ljan ljin dang / lung khung dag mthong na /
analyzed: sa chen po 'di la sdong du ma dang / tsher ma dang / sab sub dang / gcong rong dang / g-yang sa dang / ljan ljin dang / lung khung dag mthong na /
translated: if they see on this great earth stumps, thorns, brambles, ravines, cliffs, filth, and gullies,

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: they should investigate like this:

original: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na sems can gyi nyes pa de dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na sems can gyi nyes pa de dag thams cad du thams cad mi 'byung zhing mi srid pa dang /
translated: In every way I must practice the six perfections so that in my Buddha-field, when I have reached supreme enlightenment, all these faults of sentient beings will not exist, will not be heard of at all.

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de lag mthil ltar mnyam par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de lag mthil ltar mnyam par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o // sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o //
translated: And so that my Buddha-field will be as level as the palm of a hand.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: I must purify a Buddha-field, I must develop sentient beings.🔽’

translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that complete the six perfections

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: and get close to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections,

analyzed: sa chen @216b po 'di sa'i rgyu las grub pa dang / gser dngul dang mi ldan pa dag mthong na /

analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
