analyzed: bdag ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: ‘I have been prophesied by those past tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'di dag gzhan ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to zhes nas /
analyzed: 'di dag gzhan ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to zhes nas /
translated: but these others have not been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de de tsam gyis nga rgyal 'phel bar byed pa dang / nga rgyal bskyed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ring du byed /
analyzed: de de tsam gyis nga rgyal 'phel bar byed pa dang / nga rgyal bskyed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ring du byed /
translated: “Because of that, his pride increases, and he creates distance from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ring du byed na /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ring du byed na /
translated: If they distance themselves from the wisdom of unsurpassed buddhahood,

original: de ltar thabs mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
analyzed: de ltar thabs mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
translated: in this way, those bodhisattvas who are unskilled in means

original: de tsam gyis lhag pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pas des sa gnyis por 'gro bar rig par bya ste /🔽'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de tsam gyis lhag pa'i nga rgyal bskyed pas des sa gnyis por 'gro bar rig par bya ste / 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: should be known to be going to one of two levels:🔽the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar na bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i bdud kyi las 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i bdud kyi las 'byung ste /
translated: In this way, through the power of the truth, the deeds of Māra arise for those bodhisattva great beings.

original: de la de dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mi snyen mi sten cing mi 'grogs la /
analyzed: de la de dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mi snyen mi sten cing mi 'grogs la /
translated: If they do not approach, serve, and attend spiritual friends,

original: bsnyen bkur mi byed na /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi byed na /
translated: and do not honor them,

original: de nyid du bdud kyi bcings pa de dam por byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du bdud kyi bcings pa de dam por byed pa yin no //
translated: then that very thing makes the bonds of Māra very tight.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is because they have not practiced the six perfections and have not been taken hold of by skillful means.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bu'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar na @254a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bu'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / ji ltar na @254a *//
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should know that this is also the work of a demon.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: Subhuti, how is it that the Bodhisattva-mahasattva has not practiced the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the perfection of morality,🔽has not practiced the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the perfection of vigor,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the perfection of meditation,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the perfection of wisdom,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the four mindfulnesses,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the four right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la ma spyad pa /🔽dbang po lnga la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la ma spyad pa / dbang po lnga la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the four bases of supernatural power,🔽has not practiced the five faculties,

original: stobs lnga la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: stobs lnga la ma spyad pa /
translated: has not practiced the five powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la ma spyad pa /
translated: not having practiced the seven limbs of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: not having practiced the eightfold noble path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la ma spyad pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la ma spyad pa /
translated: not having practiced the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation,

original: skyon med par ma chud pa'i drung du bdud sdig to can ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis nye bar 'ong ba yin zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di la bdud sdig to can cha byad gang yang rung bas nye bar 'ongs shing /
analyzed: skyon med par ma chud pa'i drung du bdud sdig to can ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis nye bar 'ong ba yin zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di la bdud sdig to can cha byad gang yang rung bas nye bar 'ongs shing /
translated: the evil Māra will come to them by the power of his name before they have entered into flawlessness.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la 'di skad du /
translated: “Subhūti, here the evil Māra will come to a bodhisattva great being in some guise or other and say,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‘Son of a good family,

original: khyod ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ste /🔽khyod kyi ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyod ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ste / khyod kyi ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
translated: the tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha has given you a prophecy to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Your name is this.

original: khyod kyi pha'i ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi pha'i ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
translated: Your father’s name is this.

original: khyod kyi ma'i ming ni @254b 'di zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ma'i ming ni @254b 'di zhes bya'o //
translated: “Your mother’s name was such-and-such.

original: khyod kyi phu nu'i ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi phu nu'i ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
translated: Your father’s name was such-and-such.

original: khyod kyi bu sring gi ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi bu sring gi ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //
translated: Your brother’s name was such-and-such.🔽Your sister’s name was such-and-such.

original: khyod kyi mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes kyi ming ni 'di zhes bya'o zhes bya ba nas; pha ma'i rabs bdun gyi bar du nye bar ston cing /
analyzed: khyod kyi mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes kyi ming ni 'di zhes bya'o zhes bya ba nas; pha ma'i rabs bdun gyi bar du nye bar ston cing /
translated: Your friends, ministers, and relatives were such-and-such.

original: khyod ni yul che ge mo zhig dang / khyod ni grong khyer che ge mo zhig dang / khyod ni phyogs che ge mo zhig nas yul che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //🔽grong che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: khyod ni yul che ge mo zhig dang / khyod ni grong khyer che ge mo zhig dang / khyod ni phyogs che ge mo zhig nas yul che ge mo zhig tu skyes so // grong che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: You were born in such-and-such a country, in such-and-such a village, in such-and-such a region, in such-and-such a town, in such-and-such a market, in such-and-such a house.🔽You were born in such-and-such a country, in such-and-such a village, in such-and-such a region, in such-and-such a town, in such-and-such a market, in such-and-such a house.

original: grong rdal che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: grong rdal che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: You were born in such-and-such a country, in such-and-such a village, in such-and-such a region, in such-and-such a town, in such-and-such a market, in such-and-such a house.

original: gal te ngang gis 'jam pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te ngang gis 'jam pa zhig yin na /
translated: If they were naturally gentle,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'di bzhin du 'jam par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'di bzhin du 'jam par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they would say, ‘In the past, you were also like this, gentle.’

original: gal te rno ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te rno ba zhig yin na /
translated: If they were sharp,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'di bzhin du rno bar gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'di bzhin du rno bar gyur to zhes zer /
translated: He says to him, “You were also sharp in the past.”

original: gal te dgon pa pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te dgon pa pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a forest renunciant,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang dgon pa par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang dgon pa par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: he says to him, “You were also a forest renunciant in the past.”

original: gal te bsod snyoms pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te bsod snyoms pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a beggar’s renunciant,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang bsod snyoms par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang bsod snyoms par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: he says to him, “You were also a beggar’s renunciant in the past.”

original: gal te phyag dar khrod pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyag dar khrod pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a refuse-rag wearer,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang phyag dar khrod par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang phyag dar khrod par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: he says to him, “You were also a refuse-rag wearer in the past.”

original: gal te bsod snyoms phyis mi len pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te bsod snyoms phyis mi len pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a later-food-refuser,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang bsod snyoms phyis mi len par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang bsod snyoms phyis mi len par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: he says to him, “You were also a later-food-refuser in the past.”

original: gal te stan gcig pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te stan gcig pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a one-sitting eater,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang stan gcig par gyur te zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang stan gcig par gyur te zhes zer /
translated: he says to him, “You were also a one-sitting eater in the past.”

original: gal te ci thob pa'i bsod snyoms @255a *//
analyzed: gal te ci thob pa'i bsod snyoms @255a *//
translated: If he is a whatever-is-obtained beggar’s renunciant,

original: pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a refuse-rag wearer,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang ci thob pa'i bsod snyoms par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang ci thob pa'i bsod snyoms par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they say to him, “You were a refuse-rag wearer in the past as well.”

original: gal te dur khrod pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te dur khrod pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a charnel-ground dweller,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang dur khrod par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang dur khrod par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they say to him, “You were a charnel-ground dweller in the past as well.”

original: gal te bla gab med pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te bla gab med pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is an open-air dweller,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang bla gab med par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang bla gab med par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they say to him, “You were an open-air dweller in the past as well.”

original: gal te shing drung pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te shing drung pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a tree-root dweller,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang shing drung par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang shing drung par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they say to him, “You were a tree-root dweller in the past as well.”

original: gal te cog pu pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te cog pu pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a rooftop or terrace dweller,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang cog pu par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang cog pu par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they say to him, “You were a rooftop or terrace dweller in the past as well.”

original: gal te gzhi ji bzhin pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhi ji bzhin pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a whatever-is-at-hand practitioner,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang gzhi ji bzhin par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang gzhi ji bzhin par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: they say to him, “You were a whatever-is-at-hand practitioner in the past as well.”

original: gal te chos gos gsum pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos gos gsum pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is a three-piece-garment practitioner,🔽they say to him, “You were a three-piece-garment practitioner in the past as well.”

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang chos gos gsum par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang chos gos gsum par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: “You were also a wearer of the three Dharma robes in the past.”

original: gal te 'dod pa chung ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa chung ba zhig yin na /
translated: If he is one of few desires,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'dod pa chung bar gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'dod pa chung bar gyur to zhes zer /
translated: “You were also one of few desires in the past.”

original: gal te chog shes pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te chog shes pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is content,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang chog shes par gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang chog shes par gyur to zhes zer /
translated: “You were also content in the past.”

original: gal te dben pa pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te dben pa pa zhig yin na /
translated: If he is one who is secluded,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang dben pa bar gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang dben pa bar gyur to zhes zer /
translated: “You were also secluded in the past.”

original: gal te rkang pa bsku ba dang bral ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te rkang pa bsku ba dang bral ba zhig yin na /
translated: If he is one who does not massage his limbs,

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang rkang pa bsku ba dang bral bar gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang rkang pa bsku ba dang bral bar gyur to zhes zer /
translated: “You were also one who did not massage your limbs in the past.”

original: gal te smra ba nyung ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te smra ba nyung ba zhig yin na /
translated: If he is one who speaks little,

original: de de la 'di @255b skad du khyod ni sngon yang smra ba nyung bar gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di @255b skad du khyod ni sngon yang smra ba nyung bar gyur to zhes zer /
translated: “You were also one who spoke little in the past.”

original: gal te 'tham pa nyung ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'tham pa nyung ba zhig yin na /
translated: If he is one who does not embrace,🔽“You were also one who did not embrace in the past.”

original: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'tham pa nyung bar gyur to zhes zer /
analyzed: de de la 'di skad du khyod ni sngon yang 'tham pa nyung bar gyur to zhes zer /
translated: The demon will say to him, ‘You have had few embraces in the past.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar khyod la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dag yod pa las na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar khyod la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dag yod pa las na /
translated: Because you have these kinds of qualities of austerity.

original: gdon mi za bar sngon yang sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / sdom pa 'di dag dang ldan par ma gyur mi srid do zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sngon yang sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / sdom pa 'di dag dang ldan par ma gyur mi srid do zhes zer ba la /
translated: It is certain that in the past you did not lack these qualities of austerity and vows.’

original: de de ltar sngon gyi ming dang / rus bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / sdom pa bstan pas /🔽rlom sems skyed pas de ltar bdud sdig to can de'i drung du nye bar 'ongs shing 'di skad du /
analyzed: de de ltar sngon gyi ming dang / rus bstan pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / sdom pa bstan pas / rlom sems skyed pas de ltar bdud sdig to can de'i drung du nye bar 'ongs shing 'di skad du /
translated: “In this way, the demon will teach him his past name and family, and the present qualities of austerity and vows.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Because of that, the demon will approach him and say, ‘Noble son,

original: khyod ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis khyod la yon tan yod pa ci 'dra ba bzhin du /
analyzed: khyod ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis khyod la yon tan yod pa ci 'dra ba bzhin du /
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha has said that you have these qualities.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par lung bstan to zhes zer zhing /🔽yang na dge slong gi cha byad du nye bar 'ong /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par lung bstan to zhes zer zhing / yang na dge slong gi cha byad du nye bar 'ong /
translated: and that they have been prophesied to reach irreversible progress toward unsurpassed and perfect awakening.🔽They may also appear in the guise of a fully ordained monk,

original: yang na dge slong ma'i cha byad du nye bar 'ong /
analyzed: yang na dge slong ma'i cha byad du nye bar 'ong /
translated: a fully ordained nun,

original: yang na khyim bdag gi cha byad du nye bar 'ong /
analyzed: yang na khyim bdag gi cha byad du nye bar 'ong /
translated: a householder,🔽a father,

original: yang na pha'i cha byad du nye bar 'ong /🔽yang na ma'i cha byad du nye bar 'ong zhing /
analyzed: yang na pha'i cha byad du nye bar 'ong / yang na ma'i cha byad du nye bar 'ong zhing /
translated: or a mother.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: They may say,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‘Son of noble family,

original: khyod ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: khyod ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas have prophesied that you will reach unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de 'di ltar khyod la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems @256a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de 'di ltar khyod la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems @256a *//
translated: Why is that?🔽Because you have the qualities of irreversible bodhisattva great beings.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yon tan gang ji snyed pa de dag yod do zhes zer la /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yon tan gang ji snyed pa de dag yod do zhes zer la /
translated: You have all the qualities of bodhisattva great beings.’

original: rab 'byor / ngas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma gang bshad pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma gang bshad pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la med na /
translated: Subhuti, if those signs, indications, and marks of irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas that I have explained are not present in that Bodhisattva-Mahasattva,

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, other Bodhisattvas should know that this Bodhisattva-Mahasattva is empowered by Mara.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma de dag kyang med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma de dag kyang med la /
translated: Subhuti, it is because those signs, indications, and marks of irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas are not present in him,

original: ming bstan pa des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan la brnyas pa dang / 'phya ba dang smod pa byed cing khyad du gsod la smod na /
analyzed: ming bstan pa des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan la brnyas pa dang / 'phya ba dang smod pa byed cing khyad du gsod la smod na /
translated: and because by teaching that name he despises, disparages, and slanders other Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, and criticizes them.

original: rab 'byor / 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, this also should be known as a deed of Mara, a corruption of a Bodhisattva's name.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdud kyi las su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdud kyi las su rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva should know that the corruption of a name is a deed of Mara.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad pas phung po'i bdud mi shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad pas phung po'i bdud mi shes te /
translated: Subhuti, it is because a Bodhisattva who has not practiced the six perfections does not know the Mara of the skandhas,

original: gzugs mi shes /🔽tshor ba mi shes /
analyzed: gzugs mi shes / tshor ba mi shes /
translated: does not know form,🔽does not know feeling,

original: 'du shes mi shes /
analyzed: 'du shes mi shes /
translated: does not know perception,

original: @256b 'du byed mi shes /
analyzed: @256b 'du byed mi shes /
translated: does not know volitional dispositions,

original: rnam par shes pa mi shes pas de la bdud sdig to can ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis lung ston cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi shes pas de la bdud sdig to can ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis lung ston cing /
translated: does not know consciousness. Therefore, the Mara of the Evil One, through the corruption of a name, will prophesy about him, saying:🔽 🔽You have been prophesied to full enlightenment by the Tathagatas, Arhats, Fully Enlightened Ones of the past.

original: khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ming 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming gang bsams pa dang / dpyad pa de nyid brjod de /
analyzed: khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ming 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming gang bsams pa dang / dpyad pa de nyid brjod de /
translated: The bodhisattva great being will then think of a name, and the deity will say, “That is the name you will have when you become fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' shes rab 'chal pa'i ngang tshul can thabs la mi mkhas pa de 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' shes rab 'chal pa'i ngang tshul can thabs la mi mkhas pa de 'di snyam ste /
translated: At that point, the bodhisattva who is of poor character and unskilled in means will think,

original: bdag gis ming gang yid kyis rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: bdag gis ming gang yid kyis rnam par brtags te /
translated: “The name I have mentally examined,

original: bsams pa dang / rjes su dpyad pa de nyid bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i ming du 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: bsams pa dang / rjes su dpyad pa de nyid bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i ming du 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: contemplated, and analyzed will be the name I will have when I become fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.”

original: ji lta ji ltar bdud sdig to can nam /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar bdud sdig to can nam /
translated: In this way, the evil Māra,

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha'am /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha'am /
translated: or a god from the class of Māra,

original: bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs pa'i dge slong dag ston pa de lta de ltar sems shing /
analyzed: bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs pa'i dge slong dag ston pa de lta de ltar sems shing /
translated: or a monk who is under the influence of Māra will teach the bodhisattva in this way.

original: ji ltar bdag gis sems bskyed pa dang / bdag gi ming ji lta ba bzhin du dge slong 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis sems bskyed pa dang / bdag gi ming ji lta ba bzhin du dge slong 'dis bstan te /
translated: “This monk has taught me the name and the way I have generated the mind of awakening.

original: ming dang ming du mthun gyis /
analyzed: ming dang ming du mthun gyis /
translated: The name is the same as my name.

original: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to snyam nas /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha has prophesied my unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' de la gang ngas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma bshad pa de dag kyang med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' de la gang ngas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma bshad pa de dag kyang med la /
translated: “Subhūti, the irreversible bodhisattva great beings do not have the aspects, the signs, and the indications of an irreversible bodhisattva great being that I have explained.

original: ming @257a *// de dang lung bstan par brjod pa des kyang /
analyzed: ming @257a *// de dang lung bstan par brjod pa des kyang /
translated: They are not endowed with those names and those descriptions of a prophecy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag la khyad du gsod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag la khyad du gsod na /
translated: They disparage other bodhisattva great beings.

original: de rlom sems des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las ring du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rlom sems des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las ring du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that conceit they are far from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de ltar thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan la /
analyzed: de ltar thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan la /
translated: Thus, they are not skilled in means,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral zhing dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral zhing dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral te /
translated: lack the perfection of wisdom, and lack a spiritual friend.

original: sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su bzung ba de'i sa ni gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su bzung ba de'i sa ni gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: They are held by evil companions, and their level should be known as two:

original: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
translated: the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: yang na'ang shin tu yun ring por 'khor zhing 'phyan 'phyan nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen pa dang / bsten pa dang / rim gro byas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
analyzed: yang na'ang shin tu yun ring por 'khor zhing 'phyan 'phyan nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen pa dang / bsten pa dang / rim gro byas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
translated: But if they serve, attend, and honor a spiritual friend, they will, after wandering for a very long time, rely on this perfection of wisdom and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs bar 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs bar 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpas yang dang yang du dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba dang / bsnyen bkur bar ma gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpas yang dang yang du dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba dang / bsnyen bkur bar ma gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattvas do not repeatedly see and serve spiritual friends,

original: lus thob pa des sems bskyed pa snga ma dag mi smod mi 'chags na /
analyzed: lus thob pa des sems bskyed pa snga ma dag mi smod mi 'chags na /
translated: If, having obtained a human body, they do not disparage or reject their previous generation of the Thought,

original: de ni sa gnyis su 'gro bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni sa gnyis su 'gro bar rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be known that they will go to two stages:

original: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: the stage of the Disciple or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: the stage of the Solitary Sage.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / dge slong nyan thos kyi theg pa pas ltung ba'i rtsa ba bzhi las ltung ba gang yang rung ba gcig byas na /
analyzed: dper na / dge slong nyan thos kyi theg pa pas ltung ba'i rtsa ba bzhi las ltung ba gang yang rung ba gcig byas na /
translated: For example, if a monk of the Disciple Vehicle commits any one of the four root downfalls,

original: dge sbyong ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin /
translated: he is not an ascetic,

original: sh'akya'i bu ma yin par @257b 'gyur te /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu ma yin par @257b 'gyur te /
translated: not a son of the Shakya.

original: de ni lus de nyid kyis dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las dge sbyang gi 'bras bu gang yang rung ba la la 'thob par 'gyur ba'i skal ba med do //
analyzed: de ni lus de nyid kyis dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las dge sbyang gi 'bras bu gang yang rung ba la la 'thob par 'gyur ba'i skal ba med do //
translated: He has no chance to obtain any one of the four fruits of the ascetic, with that very body.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ming bstan pa tsam gyis rlom sems dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed cing ming tsam brjod pa des byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la brnyas pa dang / 'phya ba dang / khyad du gsod pa'i sems skyed pa de ni de bas kyang shin tu lci ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ming bstan pa tsam gyis rlom sems dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed cing ming tsam brjod pa des byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la brnyas pa dang / 'phya ba dang / khyad du gsod pa'i sems skyed pa de ni de bas kyang shin tu lci ba ste /
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, when a Bodhisattva, on hearing the name of another Bodhisattva, arouses a thought which is associated with conceit, and on account of that mere name, arouses a thought which is associated with contempt, disparagement, and disregard, that thought is even heavier than the former.

original: sems bskyed pa de ni de bas kyang shin tu lci bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de ni de bas kyang shin tu lci bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That thought is even heavier than the former.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar ming bstan pas bdud kyi las shin tu phra ba de lta bu dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar ming bstan pas bdud kyi las shin tu phra ba de lta bu dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, Subhuti, the deeds of Mara, which are subtle, arise through the mere indication of a name.

original: rab 'byor / ltung ba'i rtsa ba lci ba bzhi po lta zhog gi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ltung ba'i rtsa ba lci ba bzhi po lta zhog gi /
translated: Leave aside, Subhuti, the four grave offenses.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming bstan pa tsam gyis rlom sems dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa skyes pa de ni mtshams med pa lnga bas kyang shin tu lci ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming bstan pa tsam gyis rlom sems dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa skyes pa de ni mtshams med pa lnga bas kyang shin tu lci ba ste /
translated: When a Bodhisattva, on hearing the name of another Bodhisattva, arouses a thought which is associated with conceit, and on account of that mere name, arouses a thought which is associated with contempt, disparagement, and disregard, that thought is even heavier than the five deadly sins.

original: sems bskyed pa de ni de bas kyang shin tu lci bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de ni de bas kyang shin tu lci bar rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that the generation of the thought of enlightenment is even heavier than that.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dben pa'i yon tan ston cing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dben pa'i yon tan ston cing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the evil Māra, having approached a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, teaches the virtues of solitude, saying,

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni dben pa'i yon tan gsung ba'o zhes zer te /🔽rab 'byor / ngas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni dben pa'i yon tan gsung ba'o zhes zer te / rab 'byor / ngas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “The Tathāgata teaches the virtues of solitude.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, I have not taught that the solitude of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is🔽a wilderness,

original: nags 'dabs sa'am /
analyzed: nags 'dabs sa'am /
translated: a forest,

original: bas mtha'i gnas dben par ma bshad do //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan @258a *//
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas dben par ma bshad do // gsol pa / bcom ldan @258a *//
translated: or a remote place.

original: 'das / gal te de ltar dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas dben pa ma lags na /
analyzed: 'das / gal te de ltar dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas dben pa ma lags na /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, if solitude is not a wilderness, a forest, or a remote place,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dben pa gzhan ni gang zhig mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dben pa gzhan ni gang zhig mchis /
translated: then what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s other kind of solitude?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s solitude is this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dben pa gzhan ni ji lta bu zhig mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dben pa gzhan ni ji lta bu zhig mchis /
translated: What is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s other kind of solitude?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Su­bhūti,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas dben na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas dben na /
translated: if the bodhisattva mahāsattva is secluded by means of the attentions associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas na rnam par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas na rnam par spyod pa yin te /
translated: he is practicing in the wilderness, in the forest, or in isolated places.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni dben pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni dben pa ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, this is seclusion,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ngas gnang ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ngas gnang ba'o //
translated: which I have permitted for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: gal te dben pa 'dis nyin mtshan du rnam par spyod na /
analyzed: gal te dben pa 'dis nyin mtshan du rnam par spyod na /
translated: If they practice day and night in this seclusion,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas🔽are practicing in the seclusion

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dben pas dben pa rnam par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dben pas dben pa rnam par spyod pa yin no //
translated: of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas na rnam par spyod kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang 'dres par rnam par spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas na rnam par spyod kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang 'dres par rnam par spyod na /
translated: “If bodhisattva great beings are practicing in the wilderness, in the forest, or in isolated places, but are practicing while mixed up with the mental states of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mi dben par rnam par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mi dben par rnam par spyod pa yin no //
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings are practicing in a way that is not secluded.

original: gal te grong na spyod kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang ma @258b 'dres na /
analyzed: gal te grong na spyod kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang ma @258b 'dres na /
translated: “If they are practicing in a village, but are not mixed up with the mental states of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dben par rnam par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dben par rnam par spyod pa yin no //
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings are practicing in a way that is secluded.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la dben pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ngas gnang ba las dris shing bdud sdig to can de la dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas su rnam par spyod cig ces dben pa ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la dben pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ngas gnang ba las dris shing bdud sdig to can de la dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas su rnam par spyod cig ces dben pa ston te /
translated: “Subhūti, I have allowed bodhisattva great beings to have that kind of seclusion, but the evil Māra teaches that bodhisattva great beings should practice in the wilderness, in the forest, or in isolated places.

original: de dben pa des 'du 'dzir gyur cing /
analyzed: de dben pa des 'du 'dzir gyur cing /
translated: That solitude is a form of busyness for them.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang 'dres pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang 'dres pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not endeavoring in the perfection of wisdom because their mental activity is mixed up with the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not complete the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de de ltar rnam par spyod pa des rnam par spyod cing yid la bya ba yongs su ma dag pas /
analyzed: de de ltar rnam par spyod pa des rnam par spyod cing yid la bya ba yongs su ma dag pas /
translated: “They are practicing like that, but their mental activity is impure.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grong 'dabs na rnam par spyod cing yid la bya ba yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grong 'dabs na rnam par spyod cing yid la bya ba yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Other bodhisattva great beings are practicing in the vicinity of a town, and their mental activity is pure.

original: nyan thos kyi sems dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: They are not mixed up with the thought of a śrāvaka.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: They are not mixed up with the thought of a pratyekabuddha.

original: de ma yin pa sdig pa'i sems gzhan dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: de ma yin pa sdig pa'i sems gzhan dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: They are not mixed up with any other evil thought.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa dag la brnyas pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa dag la brnyas pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: They have attained the perfection of the dhyānas, liberations, samādhis, samāpattis, and higher cognitions, but they have given rise to a contemptuous attitude.🔽“Bodhisattvas who are unskilled in means should live in a wilderness that is a hundred leagues away from

original: thabs mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bas dgon pa sbrul dang / ri dvags dang / bya yod pa /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bas dgon pa sbrul dang / ri dvags dang / bya yod pa /
translated: snakes, wild animals, and birds,

original: rkun po dang / sme sha can yod pa /
analyzed: rkun po dang / sme sha can yod pa /
translated: thieves and outcasts,

original: gcan gzan mche ba can dang / srin @259a *//🔽po rgyu ba dpag tshad brgya tsam du 'phags pa de lta bu'i nang na 'dug cing /
analyzed: gcan gzan mche ba can dang / srin @259a *// po rgyu ba dpag tshad brgya tsam du 'phags pa de lta bu'i nang na 'dug cing /
translated: and carnivorous beasts and rākṣasas.

original: lo gcig gam /🔽lo brgya 'am /🔽lo stong ngam /
analyzed: lo gcig gam / lo brgya 'am / lo stong ngam /
translated: They should live in such a wilderness for one year,🔽or a hundred years,

original: lo brgya phrag stong ngam /🔽lo bye ba'am /🔽lo bye ba phrag brgya'am /
analyzed: lo brgya phrag stong ngam / lo bye ba'am / lo bye ba phrag brgya'am /
translated: or a thousand years,🔽or a hundred thousand years,

original: lo bye ba phrag stong ngam /🔽lo bye ba brgya phrag stong ngam /
analyzed: lo bye ba phrag stong ngam / lo bye ba brgya phrag stong ngam /
translated: or a million years,🔽or a billion years,🔽or a hundred billion years,

original: lo bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong ngam /
analyzed: lo bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong ngam /
translated: or a trillion years,🔽or a quintillion years,

original: de bas kyang lhag par gnas su zin kyang dben pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa la yang dag par gnas shing rnam par spyod pa de lta bu'i dben pa shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas kyang lhag par gnas su zin kyang dben pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa la yang dag par gnas shing rnam par spyod pa de lta bu'i dben pa shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they do stay in a place like that, they will not know the kind of solitude in which bodhisattva great beings who are intent on the higher intention stay and practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba mang po dang 'dres pa nyid du rnam par spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba mang po dang 'dres pa nyid du rnam par spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings will practice while mixed up with lots of attention connected with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: dben pa de la yang dag par gces par gnas shing /
analyzed: dben pa de la yang dag par gces par gnas shing /
translated: They will stay in that kind of solitude,

original: chags pa dang zhen cing mngon par zhen pa de tsam gyis ni nga'i sems rangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chags pa dang zhen cing mngon par zhen pa de tsam gyis ni nga'i sems rangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: but I am not pleased with their minds that are attached, clinging, and fixated on that much.

original: ngas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la dben pa gang bshad pa'i dben pa de dang mi ldan pas dben pa de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: ngas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la dben pa gang bshad pa'i dben pa de dang mi ldan pas dben pa de la mi gnas so //
translated: They do not have the kind of solitude that I have explained to bodhisattva great beings, and they do not stay in that kind of solitude.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar dben pa de dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dben pa de dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because that solitude is devoid of that.

original: de ltar de'i drung du bdud sdig to can nye bar 'ongs shing /
analyzed: de ltar de'i drung du bdud sdig to can nye bar 'ongs shing /
translated: In this way, Māra, the evil one, will approach him and,

original: steng gi bar snang la gnas te /
analyzed: steng gi bar snang la gnas te /
translated: standing in the sky above,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: will say:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‘Excellent, son of noble family!

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent!

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i dben pa ma nor @259b ba yin gyis khyod dben pa 'di nyid kyis ni rnam par spyod cig /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i dben pa ma nor @259b ba yin gyis khyod dben pa 'di nyid kyis ni rnam par spyod cig /
translated: This is the solitude taught by the Tathāgata. You should practice this very solitude.

original: der khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: der khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: You will quickly awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.’

original: de'i rgyus de dben pa de bas kyang dben pa de gces par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de'i rgyus de dben pa de bas kyang dben pa de gces par 'dzin cing /
translated: Because of that, he will cherish that solitude even more than before.

original: phyir grong 'dab tu 'ongs nas /
analyzed: phyir grong 'dab tu 'ongs nas /
translated: When he returns to the village,

original: dge slong byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa sems dang yid la bya ba yongs su dag pa des dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa sems dang yid la bya ba yongs su dag pa des dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa /
translated: he will say to the bhikṣus who are practicing the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, whose minds and thoughts are pure, and who possess virtuous qualities:

original: gzhan dag la tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag ni 'du 'dzi'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod do zhes khyad du gsod cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag la tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag ni 'du 'dzi'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod do zhes khyad du gsod cing /
translated: They disparage others, saying, ‘Those venerable ones are practicing in a way that is full of distractions.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dben par spyod pa de dag la 'du 'dzis rnam par spyod par skyon du gdags pa dang / 'dres par rnam par spyod par skyon du gdags pas brnyas pa'i sems bskyed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dben par spyod pa de dag la 'du 'dzis rnam par spyod par skyon du gdags pa dang / 'dres par rnam par spyod par skyon du gdags pas brnyas pa'i sems bskyed do //
translated: They disparage those bodhisattva great beings who are practicing in solitude, saying, ‘They are practicing in a way that is full of distractions,’ and ‘They are practicing in a way that is full of confusion.’

original: gang 'du 'dzi'i rnam par spyod par rnam par spyod pa de dag la ni dben pas rnam par spyod pas 'dzin cing /🔽de dag la rim gror bskyed do //
analyzed: gang 'du 'dzi'i rnam par spyod par rnam par spyod pa de dag la ni dben pas rnam par spyod pas 'dzin cing / de dag la rim gror bskyed do //
translated: They praise those who are practicing in a way that is full of distractions, saying, ‘They are practicing in a way that is full of solitude.’🔽They honor those who are practicing in a way that is full of distractions.

original: gang la rim gro bskyed par bya ba de dag la ni nga rgyal bskyed do //
analyzed: gang la rim gro bskyed par bya ba de dag la ni nga rgyal bskyed do //
translated: They are proud of those whom they honor.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar bdag ni mi ma yin pas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar bdag ni mi ma yin pas bskul ba'o //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because they are urged on by nonhuman beings.

original: mi ma yin pas dran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pas dran par bya ba'o //
translated: They are reminded by nonhuman beings.

original: rnam par spyod pa gang gis bdag spyod pa de ni rnam par spyod pa ma nor ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par spyod pa gang gis bdag spyod pa de ni rnam par spyod pa ma nor ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who practices in this way is practicing correctly.

original: grong 'dabs na spyod pa la lta su zhig bskul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: grong 'dabs na spyod pa la lta su zhig bskul bar 'gyur /
translated: Who would encourage someone to practice in the village?

original: grong 'dabs na spyod pa lta su zhig dran par byed par 'gyur zhes nga rgyal bskyed de /
analyzed: grong 'dabs na spyod pa lta su zhig dran par byed par 'gyur zhes nga rgyal bskyed de /
translated: Who would remind someone to practice in the village?

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de @260a *//
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de @260a *//
translated: In this way, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i rigs kyi bu gzhan dag la smod par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i rigs kyi bu gzhan dag la smod par byed de /
translated: the bodhisattva disparages other sons of noble family who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor / gang zag de ni byang chub sems dpa' gdol par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang zag de ni byang chub sems dpa' gdol par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that such a person is a low-caste bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sun 'byin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sun 'byin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that such a person is a bodhisattva who causes division.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that such a person is a bodhisattva who is a mere reflection.

original: de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rkun po ste /
analyzed: de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rkun po ste /
translated: Such a person is a thief in the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dge sbyong gi cha byad kyi rkun por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dge sbyong gi cha byad kyi rkun por rig par bya ste /
translated: He should be known as a thief in the guise of an ascetic by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: ngang tshul de lta bu dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: ngang tshul de lta bu dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni /
translated: A person who has such a nature🔽should not be attended upon

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag gis bsnyen par mi bya /🔽bsten par mi bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag gis bsnyen par mi bya / bsten par mi bya /
translated: by sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.🔽He should not be served.

original: rim gror mi bya'o //
analyzed: rim gror mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be honored.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / gang zag de lta bu dag ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal can du rig par bya ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yongs su ma btang la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang zag de lta bu dag ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal can du rig par bya ste / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yongs su ma btang la /
translated: Subhūti, such persons should be known as having excessive pride.🔽Even though they have not given up the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yongs su ma btang na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yongs su ma btang na /
translated: even though they have not given up unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam pa thag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam pa thag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who, with a firm intention, wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar 'dod pa des /🔽gang zag de lta bu'i ngang tshul can bsnyen par mi bya /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar 'dod pa des / gang zag de lta bu'i ngang tshul can bsnyen par mi bya /
translated: and wishes to benefit all sentient beings🔽should not attend to,🔽should not rely on,🔽should not serve

original: bsten par mi bya /🔽rim gror mi bya'i /
analyzed: bsten par mi bya / rim gror mi bya'i /
translated: such a person of that sort.

original: @260b rang gi don dang ldan par 'gyur ba la brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: @260b rang gi don dang ldan par 'gyur ba la brtson par bya ste /
translated: He should strive to accomplish his own aim,

original: 'khor ba las rtag tu skyo zhing 'jigs pa'i yid kyis khams gsum dang ma 'dres par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las rtag tu skyo zhing 'jigs pa'i yid kyis khams gsum dang ma 'dres par spyad par bya'o //
translated: and with a mind that is always weary and fearful of cyclic existence, he should practice without mixing with the three realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gdol pa de la'ang byams pa bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gdol pa de la'ang byams pa bskyed par bya ste /
translated: He should also generate love for that outcast bodhisattva,

original: de nyid la snying brtse ba'i phyir snying rje bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la snying brtse ba'i phyir snying rje bskyed par bya'o //
translated: and he should generate compassion for him out of affection.

original: dga' ba dang btang snyoms bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang btang snyoms bskyed par bya'o //
translated: He should generate joy and equanimity.

original: des sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste; ci nas kyang bdag gi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad med cing mi skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: des sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste; ci nas kyang bdag gi nyes pa 'di dag thams cad du thams cad med cing mi skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
translated: He should think, ‘I will act in such a way that all these faults of mine will not occur at all, and will not be produced.

original: gal te skyes na'ang myur du spang bar bya'o zhes bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te skyes na'ang myur du spang bar bya'o zhes bslab par bya ste /
translated: If they are produced, I will quickly get rid of them.’

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rang gis khong du chud pa'i mngon par shes pa'i mthur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rang gis khong du chud pa'i mngon par shes pa'i mthur rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this should be known as the bodhisattva great beings’ own comprehension of the power of the superknowledges.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who with higher intention want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la bsnyen par bya'o //🔽bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la bsnyen par bya'o // bsten par bya'o //
translated: should attend on spiritual friends.🔽They should follow them.

original: rim gror bya'o //
analyzed: rim gror bya'o //
translated: They should serve them.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, who are the spiritual friends of bodhisattva great beings?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes @261a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes @261a *//
translated: “Su­bhūti, the blessed buddhas

original: gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: are to be recognized as the spiritual friends of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, the bodhisattva great beings

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: are to be recognized as the spiritual friends of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / nyan thos gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug brjod cing ston pa dang / 'chad cing 'grel ba dang / rnam par 'byed cing gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nyan thos gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug brjod cing ston pa dang / 'chad cing 'grel ba dang / rnam par 'byed cing gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, the śrāvakas who proclaim, teach, explain, elucidate, and genuinely demonstrate the six transcendent perfections are also to be recognized as the spiritual friends of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the six perfections should be known as the spiritual teachers of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness should be known as the spiritual teachers of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o; ;rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o; ;rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four right efforts should be known as the spiritual teachers of the bodhisattva great beings. The four legs of magical power should be known as the spiritual teachers of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: dbang po lnga ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The five faculties should be known as the spiritual teachers of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: stobs lnga ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs lnga ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The five powers are to be known as the spiritual benefactors of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: @261b byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @261b byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are to be known as the spiritual benefactors of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //🔽bsam gtan bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o // bsam gtan bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The noble eightfold path is to be known as the spiritual benefactor of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.🔽The four noble truths are to be known as the spiritual benefactors of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.🔽The four concentrations are to be known as the spiritual benefactors of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: tshad med pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four immeasurables are to be known as the spiritual benefactors of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four formless absorptions are to be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The eight liberations are to be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are to be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //🔽mngon par shes pa rnams ni byang chub sems @262a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o // mngon par shes pa rnams ni byang chub sems @262a *//
translated: The emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation are to be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The clairvoyances are to be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meditative stabilities should be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //🔽mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o // mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas should be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.🔽The four fearlessnesses should be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four detailed and thorough knowledges should be known as the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The eighteen special qualities of the Buddha are the good spiritual friends of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin nyid dang; yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang; yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: The suchness, the reality-limit, and the dharma-element are the good spiritual friends of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pha drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ston par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pha drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ston par rig par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the six perfections are the teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni lam mo //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni snang ba'o //
